diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Vibrio fluvialis hemorrhagic cellulitis and cerebritis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of Vibrio fluvialis hemorrhagic cellulitis and cerebritis was supported by the patient's high fever, chills, painful swelling of the left lower leg following fire-ant stings and wading in brackish water, laboratory findings indicating infection, and the subsequent identification of V. fluvialis from wound cultures.
